aldea.title: La Aldea del Obispo
aldea.p1: Nestled in the plains of Cáceres, La Aldea del Obispo is a small village that preserves the authentic spirit of rural Extremadura.
aldea.p2: Among its landmarks stands the Parish Church of Our Lady of the Rosary, a Baroque-style temple built over an earlier structure.
aldea.p3: From here, you can enjoy hiking routes such as the Lavadera Bridge trail along the Tozo River — perfect for connecting with nature.

trujillo.title: Trujillo
trujillo.p1: Trujillo is one of the most historically significant cities in Extremadura. Its castle, main square, and noble houses tell the story of a town deeply linked to the age of explorers.
trujillo.p2: The city preserves a medieval atmosphere in every corner, full of charm and culture.
trujillo.p3: A must-do experience is joining a guided tour through the castle and the old town.

bodegas.title: Bodegas Habla
bodegas.p1: Located in Trujillo, Bodegas Habla is one of Extremadura’s most innovative wineries, where tradition meets modern design.
bodegas.p2: Its contemporary architecture blends harmoniously with the natural landscape, and its wines are recognized internationally.
bodegas.p3: A guided tour or wine tasting is highly recommended for wine lovers.

birding.title: Birding
birding.p1: Extremadura is one of Europe’s top destinations for birdwatching, home to over 300 bird species throughout the year.
birding.p2: Among the most emblematic are the black vulture, black stork, Spanish imperial eagle, and common crane.
birding.p3: Enjoy guided tours to observe these magnificent birds in their natural habitat.

monfrague.title: Monfragüe
monfrague.p1: Monfragüe is Extremadura’s great natural sanctuary, declared a National Park in 2007.
monfrague.p2: Its most iconic viewpoint, Salto del Gitano, offers breathtaking views and is perfect for spotting birds of prey in flight.
monfrague.p3: An ideal destination for birdwatching and hiking.

caceres.title: Cáceres
caceres.p1: A UNESCO World Heritage City, Cáceres boasts one of the best-preserved medieval and Renaissance ensembles in Europe.
caceres.p2: Walking through its cobbled streets feels like stepping back in time.
caceres.p3: We recommend a nighttime guided tour of the historic quarter.

jara.title: Villuercas Ibores Jara
jara.p1: A UNESCO Global Geopark combining mountains, fossils, and valleys of great geological value.
jara.p2: The area preserves traditional villages with a strong rural identity.
jara.p3: Don’t miss the famous ‘Extremaduran Appalachians’ hiking route.

guadalupe.title: Guadalupe
guadalupe.p1: The Royal Monastery of Santa María de Guadalupe is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of Spain’s most iconic religious landmarks.
guadalupe.p2: The village retains its traditional architecture and charming cobbled streets.
guadalupe.p3: A guided visit to the monastery and its museum is a must.

vera.title: La Vera
vera.p1: A picturesque region at the foot of the Gredos Mountains, famous for its natural gorges and mild microclimate.
vera.p2: It’s the birthplace of La Vera paprika, a product with its own Protected Designation of Origin.
vera.p3: In summer, you can swim in natural pools such as the Garganta de Cuartos.

description.title: Description
description.p1: Located just two hours from Madrid, in the village of La Aldea del Obispo (Cáceres, Extremadura), La Casa del Aire stands in the heart of the Extremaduran countryside. This cozy 19th-century stone house perfectly blends rustic charm with contemporary details.
description.p2: Surrounded by a unique natural landscape, it’s the ideal place to unwind and explore the most iconic sites of the region: La Aldea del Obispo, Trujillo, Monfragüe National Park, Cáceres, the Villuercas-Ibores-Jara Geopark, Guadalupe, and the La Vera region.
description.p3: You can also enjoy day trips to local attractions such as Bodegas Habla or experience birdwatching — one of the most special activities this land has to offer.
description.p4: The house can accommodate up to 8 guests and is distributed over two floors with three double bedrooms.
description.p5: On the ground floor, you’ll find a living room with a fireplace and two large sofas, a dining room, a fully equipped kitchen, and a bathroom. Upstairs, there are two double bedrooms, a full bathroom, and a spacious 25 m² terrace.
description.p6: The large courtyard — featuring a barbecue, plunge pool, and terrace — connects to an independent apartment. This additional space includes a kitchen, dining area, bedroom, and bathroom, and has its own private access for extra comfort and privacy.

conditions.title: General accommodation conditions
conditions.intro: These conditions are designed to ensure a comfortable, safe, and respectful stay for you, other guests, and the local community. Please read the rules carefully before your arrival and during your stay.

checkin.title: Check-in and check-out times
items: Check-in: From 4:00 p.m.
Check-out: Before 12:00 p.m.
For other times, please check with the property. You must inform us of your expected arrival time.

smoke.title: Smoke-free space
items: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside all indoor areas of the house.
Failure to comply will result in a €50 penalty for deodorization.

pets.title: Pets
items: Pets are not allowed inside or to stay in the house.
Failure to comply will result in a €30 penalty.

fireplace.title: Fireplace use
items: Firewood, kindling, and other materials to light the fireplace are provided free of charge.
Please make responsible use of the materials.
For safety reasons, do not leave the fireplace door open.
Important note: The pinecones displayed in the living room are decorative and must not be used as fuel.

bbq.title: Barbecue use
items: The barbecue operates on gas.
Upon request, a propane or butane cylinder will be provided free of charge.

pool.title: Pool rules
items: The property is not responsible for any misuse of the pool.
Children must always be supervised on-site by a responsible adult.
Running on the edges of the pool or surrounding areas is not allowed due to the risk of slipping.
Pushing or engaging in dangerous games is prohibited.
Access is forbidden to individuals with contagious diseases and to animals in the pool area.
Swimming after consuming alcohol or substances that impair awareness is strictly prohibited.

rules.title: Occupancy, events, and quiet hours
items: The house may not be used for bachelor/bachelorette parties or for activities that are noisy, harmful, dangerous, or illegal.
Use of the house is limited exclusively to registered guests. Over-occupancy will be reported to the relevant authorities.
Quiet hours are from 11:00 p.m. to 9:00 a.m.
The property reserves the right to cancel the stay of any guest who does not comply with these rules, at any time and without refund.

id.title: Mandatory identification (ID)
items: All guests over 14 years old must complete a registration link with their ID information to comply with the mandatory traveler registry required by law.

eco.title: Environmental care and house maintenance
items: Ecology: Please make sure that all taps are closed and that the heating/air conditioning and lights are turned off before leaving.
Recycling and waste: There are bins for recycling; please use them appropriately. Before leaving, ensure that trash is collected (there are containers near the house for disposal).
Kitchenware: Please leave dishes, glasses, and cutlery in the dishwasher. Pots, pans, and wine glasses do not need to be included.

lost.title: Lost items
items: Please make sure to take all your personal belongings with you. The property is not responsible for any items lost or left behind in the house or on the premises.

01.title: Parish Church of Our Lady of the Rosary (La Aldea del Obispo)
01.caption: A Baroque-style temple built on an earlier structure, preserving historical elements in its bell tower and stone walls. It is the main monument of the town and the cultural and religious center of the community.

02.title: Tozo River (natural surroundings of La Aldea del Obispo)
02.caption: A landscape of the Extremaduran dehesa crossed by the Tozo River, flowing quietly among holm oaks and meadows. Its calm waters and natural setting offer ideal routes for walking and enjoying local biodiversity.

03.title: Trujillo Castle
03.caption: A fortress of Arab origin built between the 9th and 12th centuries, crowning the highest point of the city. From its walls, you can enjoy spectacular panoramic views of the region and Trujillo’s historic center.

04.title: Trujillo Main Square
04.caption: The heart of the city, surrounded by Renaissance palaces and historic buildings. The equestrian statue of Francisco Pizarro stands out, along with the lively atmosphere of terraces and cultural events.

05.title: Bodegas Habla – Facade
05.caption: The facade of Bodegas Habla reflects a contemporary design that harmonizes with the natural environment of the Extremaduran dehesa. Its avant-garde architecture symbolizes the winery’s innovative philosophy and makes it a benchmark in wine tourism.

06.title: Bodegas Habla – Barrel Room
06.caption: A space where the wine rests in French oak barrels, following an aging process that gives character and quality to Habla’s signature wines. The room combines tradition and technology, creating a unique atmosphere that enhances each vintage.

07.title: Birding – Griffon Vultures in Flight
07.caption: Griffon vultures, with their majestic wings, soar through the Extremaduran skies, gliding for kilometers on warm air currents. Their presence is one of the main attractions for birdwatching enthusiasts.

08.title: Birding – Seagulls in Their Nests
08.caption: Seagulls use Extremadura’s reservoirs and wetlands as nesting habitats, forming colonies that are fascinating to observe. Their nesting behavior reveals the richness and diversity of the region’s birdlife.

09.title: Facade
09.caption: Night view of the house’s main entrance, with the Church of Our Lady of the Rosary visible in the background. The house is located on the village’s main street, with easy parking.

10.title: Salto del Gitano, Monfragüe
10.caption: One of the park’s most iconic spots, where dramatic cliffs rise above the Tagus River. It’s a privileged point for observing raptors such as griffon vultures, black storks, and imperial eagles.

11.title: Tagus River Meander, Monfragüe
11.caption: Panoramic view of the Tagus River winding between mountains covered in Mediterranean forest. The landscape conveys the park’s natural grandeur and its role as one of Spain’s most valuable protected areas.

12.title: Monumental Cáceres by Night
12.caption: Night view of the monumental complex of Cáceres, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The lighting enhances the medieval walls, towers, and palaces that make this city one of the best-preserved historic centers in Europe.

13.title: Sierra de las Villuercas
13.caption: Panoramic view of the Sierra de las Villuercas, the heart of the UNESCO-designated geopark. Its rocky ridges and deep valleys reveal millions of years of geological history in a unique Extremaduran landscape.

14.title: Natural Viewpoint in the Geopark
14.caption: A viewpoint framed by rock formations offers breathtaking views of the geopark. The combination of nature and geological heritage makes this an essential stop for hiking and photography lovers.

15.title: View of the Monastery of Guadalupe
15.caption: The Royal Monastery of Santa María de Guadalupe, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, dominates the town’s skyline. Founded in the 14th century, it was an important pilgrimage center and preserves an impressive artistic and architectural ensemble.

16.title: Cloister of the Monastery of Guadalupe
16.caption: The monastery’s Mudejar cloister offers a serene and monumental atmosphere, with a Gothic pavilion in the center surrounded by gardens and arcades. A place that reflects the cultural and spiritual richness of this historic site.

17.title: Natural Gorge in La Vera
17.caption: One of the many crystal-clear gorges that run through the region of La Vera. Between waterfalls and natural pools, these spots are perfect for cooling off in summer and enjoying nature.

18.title: Villanueva de la Vera
18.caption: Charming street in Villanueva de la Vera, where traditional architecture with wooden frameworks, flowered balconies, and a warm atmosphere is preserved. This village, declared a Historic-Artistic Site, embodies the authentic essence of La Vera.
